verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 11:16
verses.text: And he attached to himself many of the Jews, and many also of the Greeks.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 11:17
verses.text: He was the Christ.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 11:18
verses.text: When Pilate, on the accusation of our principal men, condemned him to the cross, those who had loved him in the beginning did not cease loving him.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 11:19
verses.text: For he appeared unto them again alive on the third day, the divine prophets having told these and countless other wonderful things concerning him.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 11:20
verses.text: Moreover, the race of Christians, named after him, continues down to the present day".

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 11:21
verses.text: Since an historian, who is one of the Hebrews themselves, has recorded in his work these things concerning John the Baptist and our Saviour, what excuse is there left for not convicting them of being destitute of all shame, who have forged the acts against them? But let this suffice here.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:1
verses.text: Chapter XII.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:2
verses.text: —The Disciples of our Saviour.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:3
verses.text: The names of the apostles of our Saviour are known to every one from the Gospels.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:4
verses.text: But there exists no catalogue of the seventy disciples.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:5
verses.text: Barnabas, indeed, is said to have been one of them, of whom the Acts of the apostles makes mention in various places, and especially Paul in his Epistle to the Galatians.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:6
verses.text: They say that Sosthenes also, who wrote to the Corinthians with Paul, was one of them.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:7
verses.text: This is the account of Clement in the fifth book of his Hypotyposes, in which he also says that Cephas was one of the seventy disciples, a man who bore the same name as the apostle Peter, and the one concerning whom Paul says, "When Cephas came to Antioch I withstood him to his face".

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:8
verses.text: Matthias, also, who was numbered with the apostles in the place of Judas, and the one who was honored by being made a candidate with him, are likewise said to have been deemed worthy of the same calling with the seventy.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:9
verses.text: They say that Thaddeus also was one of them, concerning whom I shall presently relate an account which has come down to us.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:10
verses.text: And upon examination you will find that our Saviour had more than seventy disciples, according to the testimony of Paul, who says that after his resurrection from the dead he appeared first to Cephas, then to the twelve, and after them to above five hundred brethren at once, of whom some had fallen asleep; but the majority were still living at the time he wrote.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:11
verses.text: Afterwards he says he appeared unto James, who was one of the so-called brethren of the Saviour.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:12
verses.text: But, since in addition to these, there were many others who were called apostles, in imitation of the Twelve, as was Paul himself, he adds: "Afterward he appeared to all the apostles".

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:13
verses.text: So much in regard to these persons.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 12:14
verses.text: But the story concerning Thaddeus is as follows.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:1
verses.text: Chapter XIII.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:2
verses.text: —Narrative concerning the Prince of the Edessenes.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:3
verses.text: The divinity of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ being noised abroad among all men on account of his wonder-working power, he attracted countless numbers from foreign countries lying far away from Judea, who had the hope of being cured of their diseases and of all kinds of sufferings.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:4
verses.text: For instance the King Abgarus, who ruled with great glory the nations beyond the Euphrates, being afflicted with a terrible disease which it was beyond the power of human skill to cure, when he heard of the name of Jesus, and of his miracles, which were attested by all with one accord sent a message to him by a courier and begged him to heal his disease.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:5
verses.text: But he did not at that time comply with his request; yet he deemed him worthy of a personal letter in which he said that he would send one of his disciples to cure his disease, and at the same time promised salvation to himself and all his house.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:6
verses.text: Not long afterward his promise was fulfilled.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:7
verses.text: For after his resurrection from the dead and his ascent into heaven, Thomas, one of the twelve apostles, under divine impulse sent Thaddeus, who was also numbered among the seventy disciples of Christ, to Edessa, as a preacher and evangelist of the teaching of Christ.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:8
verses.text: And all that our Saviour had promised received through him its fulfillment.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:9
verses.text: You have written evidence of these things taken from the archives of Edessa, which was at that time a royal city.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:10
verses.text: For in the public registers there, which contain accounts of ancient times and the acts of Abgarus, these things have been found preserved down to the present time.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:11
verses.text: But there is no better way than to hear the epistles themselves which we have taken from the archives and have literally translated from the Syriac language in the following manner.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:12
verses.text: Copy of an epistle written by Abgarus the ruler to Jesus, and sent to him at Jerusalem by Ananiasthe swift courier.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:13
verses.text: "Abgarus, ruler of Edessa, to Jesus the excellent Saviour who has appeared in the country of Jerusalem, greeting.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:14
verses.text: I have heard the reports of thee and of thy cures as performed by thee without medicines or herbs.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:15
verses.text: For it is said that thou makest the blind to see and the lame to walk, that thou cleansest lepers and castest out impure spirits and demons, and that thou healest those afflicted with lingering disease, and raisest the dead.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:16
verses.text: And having heard all these things concerning thee, I have concluded that one of two things must be true: either thou art God, and having come down from heaven thou doest these things, or else thou, who doest these things, art the Son of God.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:17
verses.text: I have therefore written to thee to ask thee that thou wouldest take the trouble to come to me and heal the disease which I have.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:18
verses.text: For I have heard that the Jews are murmuring against thee and are plotting to injure thee.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:19
verses.text: But I have a very small yet noble city which is great enough for us both".

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:20
verses.text: The answer of Jesus to the ruler Abgarus by the courier Ananias.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:21
verses.text: "Blessed art thou who hast believed in me without having seen me.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:22
verses.text: For it is written concerning me, that they who have seen me will not believe in me, and that they who have not seen me will believe and be saved.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:23
verses.text: But in regard to what thou hast written me, that I should come to thee, it is necessary for me to fulfill all things here for which I have been sent, and after I have fulfilled them thus to be taken up again to him that sent me.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:24
verses.text: But after I have been taken up I will send to thee one of my disciples, that he may heal thy disease and give life to thee and thine".

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:25
verses.text: To these epistles there was added the following account in the Syriac language.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:26
verses.text: "After the ascension of Jesus, Judas, who was also called Thomas, sent to him Thaddeus, an apostle, one of the Seventy.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:27
verses.text: When he was come he lodged with Tobias, the son of Tobias.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:28
verses.text: When the report of him got abroad, it was told Abgarus that an apostle of Jesus was come, as he had written him.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:29
verses.text: Thaddeus began then in the power of God to heal every disease and infirmity, insomuch that all wondered.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:30
verses.text: And when Abgarus heard of the great and wonderful things which he did and of the cures which he performed, he began to suspect that he was the one of whom Jesus had written him, saying, 'After I have been taken up I will send to thee one of my disciples who will heal thee.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:32
verses.text: Therefore, summoning Tobias, with whom Thaddeus lodged, he said, I have heard that a certain man of power has come and is lodging in thy house.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:33
verses.text: Bring him to me.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:34
verses.text: And Tobias coming to Thaddeus said to him, The ruler Abgarus summoned me and told me to bring thee to him that thou mightest heal him.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:35
verses.text: And Thaddeus said, I will go, for I have been sent to him with power.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:36
verses.text: Tobias therefore arose early on the following day, and taking Thaddeus came to Abgarus.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:37
verses.text: And when he came, the nobles were present and stood about Abgarus.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:38
verses.text: And immediately upon his entrance a great vision appeared to Abgarus in the countenance of the apostle Thaddeus.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:39
verses.text: When Abgarus saw it he prostrated himself before Thaddeus, while all those who stood about were astonished; for they did not see the vision, which appeared to Abgarus alone.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:40
verses.text: He then asked Thaddeus if he were in truth a disciple of Jesus the Son of God, who had said to him, 'I will send thee one of my disciples, who shall heal thee and give thee life.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:41
verses.text: ' And Thaddeus said, Because thou hast mightily believed in him that sent me, therefore have I been sent unto thee.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:42
verses.text: And still further, if thou believest in him, the petitions of thy heart shall be granted thee as thou believest.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:43
verses.text: And Abgarus said to him, So much have I believed in him that I wished to take an army and destroy those Jews who crucified him, had I not been deterred from it by reason of the dominion of the Romans.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:44
verses.text: And Thaddeus said, Our Lord has fulfilled the will of his Father, and having fulfilled it has been taken up to his Father.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:45
verses.text: And Abgarus said to him, I too have believed in him and in his Father.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:46
verses.text: And Thaddeus said to him, Therefore I place my hand upon thee in his name.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:47
verses.text: And when he had done it, immediately Abgarus was cured of the disease and of the suffering which he had.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:48
verses.text: And Abgarus marvelled, that as he had heard concerning Jesus, so he had received in very deed through his disciple Thaddeus, who healed him without medicines and herbs, and not only him, but also Abdus the son of Abdus, who was afflicted with the gout; for he too came to him and fell at his feet, and having received a benediction by the imposition of his hands, he was healed.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:49
verses.text: The same Thaddeus cured also many other inhabitants of the city, and did wonders and marvelous works, and preached the word of God.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:50
verses.text: And afterward Abgarus said, Thou, O Thaddeus, doest these things with the power of God, and we marvel.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:51
verses.text: But, in addition to these things, I pray thee to inform me in regard to the coming of Jesus, how he was born; and in regard to his power, by what power he performed those deeds of which I have heard.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:52
verses.text: And Thaddeus said, Now indeed will I keep silence, since I have been sent to proclaim the word publicly.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:53
verses.text: But tomorrow assemble for me all thy citizens, and I will preach in their presence and sow among them the word of God, concerning the coming of Jesus, how he was born; and concerning his mission, for what purpose he was sent by the Father; and concerning the power of his works, and the mysteries which he proclaimed in the world, and by what power he did these things; and concerning his new preaching, and his abasement and humiliation, and how he humbled himself, and died and debased his divinity and was crucified, and descended into Hades, and burst the bars which from eternity had not been broken, and raised the dead; for he descended alone, but rose with many, and thus ascended to his Father.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:54
verses.text: Abgarus therefore commanded the citizens to assemble early in the morning to hear the preaching of Thaddeus, and afterward he ordered gold and silver to be given him.

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:55
verses.text: But he refused to take it, saying, If we have forsaken that which was our own, how shall we take that which is another's? These things were done in the three hundred and fortieth year".

verses.name: Eusebius: Chuch History Book I 13:56
verses.text: I have inserted them here in their proper place, translated from the Syriac literally, and I hope to good purpose.
